benchmark_details.name: REASON ZOO
benchmark_details.overview: REASON ZOO is a comprehensive benchmark encompassing nine diverse reasoning categories to evaluate the effectiveness of Tool-Integrated Reasoning (TIR) across various domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate reasoning capabilities of LLMs through a diverse array of tasks and new efficiency metrics in reasoning.

data.source: Constructed from nine unique reasoning subcategories with specific tasks designed to evaluate various reasoning dimensions.
data.annotation: Manually annotated and generated based on predefined problem sets.

methodology.calculation: PAC measures the computational cost required to achieve a specific performance threshold; AUC-PCC evaluates cumulative performance across varying computational budgets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PAC and AUC-PCC indicate more efficient reasoning with reduced operational overhead.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluation of TIR-enabled models across diverse reasoning tasks.
